Name: open
Description: It opens files, directories, or URLs using the default application or a specified one.

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Specifies the application to use for opening the file.

Arguments.Name: b
Arguments.Description: Specifies the bundle identifier for the application to use when opening the file.

Arguments.Name: e
Arguments.Description: It opens a file with the TextEdit application.

Arguments.Name: t
Arguments.Description: Opens the file with the default text editor.

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Reads input from standard input and opens the results in the default text editor.

Arguments.Name: F
Arguments.Description: This argument opens an application "fresh," without restoring windows.

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: The `-W` argument command waits until the applications it opens have exited.

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Reveals the file(s) in the Finder instead of opening them.

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Opens a new instance of the application(s) even if one is already running.

Arguments.Name: g
Arguments.Description: The `-g` argument launches the application without bringing it to the foreground.

Arguments.Name: j
Arguments.Description: Launches the app hidden.

Arguments.Name: --arch
Arguments.Description: Launches with the given CPU architecture type and subtype.

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Searches header locations for a specified header name and opens it, enhancing performance.

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: The `-s` argument allows specifying a partial or full SDK name for usage.

Arguments.Name: u
Arguments.Description: Opens a URL with the application that claims the URL scheme.

Arguments.Name: --args
Arguments.Description: Passes remaining arguments to the opened application's main function.

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: Adds a specified environment variable to the launched application.

Arguments.Name: --stdin
Arguments.Description: Launches the application with stdin connected to a specified path.

Arguments.Name: --stdout
Arguments.Description: Launches the application with stdout connected to a specified path.

Arguments.Name: --stderr
Arguments.Description: Connects the standard error output to a specified path.
